============================================================================================

3. reproduce steps:
3.1 I loaded an ISO image of Ubuntu 14.04.03 LTS to OpenStack images.
3.2 I did an volume at 22 GBs.
3.3 I tried to lunch an instance from a created volume with Ubuntu OS.
3.4 I got an error message.

Expected result:
* successfully created virtual machine with its own virtual storage device.

Actual result:
* An error message.
title: 'Unexpected API Error' when I try to create a VM on cinder volume

3. reproduce steps:
3.1 I loaded an ISO image of Ubuntu 14.04.03 LTS to OpenStack images.
3.2 I did an volume at 22 GBs.
3.3 I tried to lunch an instance from a created volume with Ubuntu OS.
3.4 I got an error message.

Expected result:
* successfully created virtual machine with its own virtual storage device.

Actual result:
* An error message.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ramirezkiv

comments.content:
Ilya, at some point you seem to have used x64 as the architecture per the error message. Can you check the command line arguments you used when you were trying this scenario? You should be using X86_64 instead.

Thanks,
Dims
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content:
Hello!

No, I can't check this because I didn't try this scenario with a command line.

I have always used an Web-interface: Horizon.

All I can do in this case is to upload an 32-bit iso of Ubuntu and try to launch instance with it.

When I get a results I will notify you.

comments.content:

comments.content:
Hello again. Today I have tried very basic image - cirros 0.3.4 x86 and I was surprised that I couldn't launch the instance beacuse of this error: "Error: Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible. <class 'keystoneclient.exceptions.BadRequest'> (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-d1a01d96-d9cd-4ebf-a973-9be01d7add5e)".

Cut from nova-api.log in controller:
